Text.Value: A lovely chap. Didn't kick arse in the Blood War, but that's neither here nor there.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's winding Wyll up a little/ bringing the focus back onto herself. This is a friendly tug-of-war rather than a very serious one.

Text.Value: All right, ivory tower. Tell me more about how a tiefling kid should survive the shit life throws at him. I'm all ears.
You know what it's like. If given half a chance, the Coast would eat a tiefling alive - never mind one that'd been to the Hells and back. If the kid's got a skill, he should use it however he can.
Sorry, soldier, but I didn't ask for your two coppers. The advice I give a tief kid from the Coast is between me and them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Good-humouredly, but she's not too impressed by the player here.

Text.Value: It is, isn't it. Hope he makes it out of this mess with his wits in one piece. I'd like to see him set up in a proper home in the city. Every kid deserves that.
'Scamming with the greats'? What kind of advice is that?
Heya - you're back! I was thinking... I didn't recognise you before, but you're... you're Karlach, aren't you?
I saw you lay out a maw demon in two hits! Bam, bam! We were all like 'whoa'.
That's true - but he never got kidnapped by a devil either.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still a friendly repartee but Wyll is tryign to get the uperhand and it might be getting a little arch.

Text.Value: I've been tossed around a lot too. I want to learn how to fight back, too.
Kid really looks up to you. That's nice to see.
Uhhh. Huh?

EditorData.NodeContext: Mattis is listening to Wyll and Karlach argue and trying to get waht they're saying. This is the breaking point in the humorous tension up to this point.

Text.Value: How'd you learn to fight like that?
Welcome to our humble - wait, are you Karlach?
No, he only sold his soul to one.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still a friendly repartee but it's getting pointed now.

Text.Value: Well! I, uh - yeah. I guess I was. I mean, you should avoid fighting for devils if you can. But if you can't, it helps to have a good right hook.

EditorData.NodeContext: Karlach is feeling a little chuffed at the positive attention here. She's trying to be a good role model but is also delighted that her reputation precedes her

Text.Value: A lot of us were in Avernus. We saw you fighting. You were so good!
Sorry, kid. Look, forget about us begrudgers and bruisers.
Even I'm not thick enough to fall for the same trick twice. But keep it up, kid, and you'll be scamming with the greats in no time.

EditorData.NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

Text.Value: Fight with those, and you may find you never need to use your fists at all.
Ever heard of the Blade of Frontiers, kid? If you like monster-smashing, you might be a fan of his work.
Ha! Nice try, shorty. Keep it up, though, and you'll be scamming with the greats in no time.

EditorData.NodeContext: Lighthearted, ribbing the kid. This is a goodbye. After this, Karlach and the kid disengage and the player addresses karlach.

Text.Value: In that case, want to buy a lucky ring I found?
I used to be that little runt. And anyway, he seems like a good kid. Let's make sure he gets to the city safely.
From the look of things, you've got your wits about you. A clever mind and a bit of style will take you a long way.
Who's that?
You were too nice to that little runt.
Had to. Life didn't pull any punches. It was up to me to learn to take a hit - and deal one back.
Leave.

Synopsis: If Mattis makes it to HAV and speaks with Karlach, he will recognize her from the Blood Wars. Karlach then will give him a good advice. If companion Wyll is nearby he will join the conversation.
